title: [Large-scale] Comparative Analysis of 4C/ID Model-based Clinical Practice Education Courses: Patient-centered Nursing Simulation Application

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge, clinical practice experience, understanding of fundamental patient assessment techniques and nursing protocol
context.additional_context: Structuring learning activities using smartphones in limited technological environments. Includes symptom observation, diagnostic reasoning, and treatment planning activities based on real clinical scenarios. Establishes an evaluation system reflecting patient safety protocols and medical ethics standards.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the 4C/ID modelâ€™s four components (learning objectives, learning tasks, supportive information, procedural information) to patient diagnosis protocols and nursing intervention designs.

Learners can comparatively analyze structural differences in domestic and international clinical practicum curricula from a 4C/ID model perspective and evaluate differences in symptom management and treatment protocols.
Learners can implement project-based assessments to enhance practical skills in mobile microlearning environments and verify compliance with patient safety and medical protocols.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
